title: [Self-Directed] Comparative Analysis of Difficulty Levels in Mobile and Desktop Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of the ADDIE model and basic instructional design principles
context.additional_context: Project-based learning comparing mobile/desktop instructional design processes in smartphone-dominant environments

learning_goals: Applying the ADDIE model, learners can develop one instructional design plan each suitable for mobile and desktop environments
Learners can analyze the impact of internet speed and device characteristics on instructional design and prepare comparative reports
Learners can identify at least three major difficulty factors in mobile/desktop design processes and propose improvement strategies

resources: Google Docs/Notion and Other Collaboration Tools
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
